faqs.question: How quickly can you start a project?
faqs.answer: For lawn care and maintenance, we can usually start within a week. Design and hardscaping projects are typically scheduled 2-4 weeks out depending on the season. {{city}} spring is our busiest time, so we recommend booking early.

faqs.question: Do you offer free estimates?
faqs.answer: Yes. {{businessName}} provides free, no-obligation estimates for all landscaping projects. For design work, we offer a free initial consultation to discuss your vision, budget, and timeline. Call us at {{phone}} to schedule yours.

faqs.question: Are you licensed and insured?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. {{businessName}} is fully licensed ({{licenseNumber}}), bonded, and insured. Our crews are trained professionals who treat your property with care and follow all local {{city}} regulations.

faqs.question: Do you guarantee your work?
faqs.answer: Yes. We stand behind everything we do. Plants are guaranteed for one full growing season. Hardscaping comes with a {{warrantyYears}}-year workmanship warranty. If something is not right, we will make it right.

faqs.question: How often should my lawn be mowed?
faqs.answer: During peak growing season, weekly mowing is recommended to keep your lawn healthy and looking sharp. In slower seasons, biweekly is usually sufficient. {{businessName}} adjusts the schedule based on growth rates and weather conditions in {{city}}.

faqs.question: When should I fertilize my lawn?
faqs.answer: Fertilization timing depends on your grass type. Cool-season grasses benefit from spring and fall applications, while warm-season grasses do best with summer fertilization. We create a custom fertilization schedule tailored to your lawn and {{city}}'s climate.

faqs.question: How do I get rid of weeds without killing my lawn?
faqs.answer: The best approach combines pre-emergent treatments in early spring, targeted post-emergent applications for existing weeds, and proper lawn care practices that promote thick, healthy turf. A dense, well-maintained lawn is your best long-term defense against weeds.

faqs.question: Do you offer ongoing maintenance plans?
faqs.answer: Yes. We offer weekly, biweekly, and monthly maintenance plans that include mowing, edging, trimming, fertilization, and seasonal treatments. Plans are customized to your property's size and needs. Call {{phone}} to discuss options.

faqs.question: How long does a full landscape design project take?
faqs.answer: The design phase typically takes 1-2 weeks depending on project complexity. Installation ranges from a few days for simple plantings to 2-4 weeks for complete landscape transformations including hardscaping, irrigation, and lighting.

faqs.question: Can I do the project in phases to spread out the cost?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Phased installation is one of the most popular approaches we offer. We design the complete vision upfront, then prioritize and install in stages that fit your budget. Many {{city}} homeowners spread their project over two or three seasons.

faqs.question: What materials do you recommend for patios?
faqs.answer: For {{city}}'s climate, we typically recommend concrete pavers or natural stone like travertine and flagstone. Both are durable, low-maintenance, and available in many styles and colors. We will help you choose the best option based on your design preferences and budget.

faqs.question: How much water can I save with a drip irrigation system?
faqs.answer: Drip irrigation typically reduces water usage by 40-60% compared to traditional sprinkler systems. Combined with a smart controller that adjusts to weather conditions, many {{city}} homeowners see their outdoor water bills cut in half.

faqs.question: How often should my irrigation system be serviced?
faqs.answer: We recommend a full system inspection at least twice per year â€” once in spring before the growing season and once in fall for winterization. Regular checks catch leaks and broken heads early, preventing water waste and plant damage.

faqs.question: What is the best time to water my landscape?
faqs.answer: Early morning between 4 AM and 6 AM is ideal. Watering at this time minimizes evaporation, reduces disease risk from wet foliage overnight, and ensures plants have moisture available before the heat of the day. {{businessName}} programs all smart controllers for optimal timing.
